E-1.Description: The entry-level rank in the Army, privates perform basic combat training and learn essential military skills.
Responsibilities: Following orders and regulations
Basic combat training
Physical fitness and conditioning
Weapons handling and marksmanship
Military courtesy and discipline

E-2.Description: PFCs build on the skills learned as privates and advance to more responsibilities within their units.
Responsibilities: Advanced individual training
Leading and mentoring junior soldiers
Specialized job duties based on MOS
Increased accountability and independence
Advanced weapons training

E-4.Description: Specialists are skilled enlisted soldiers who have completed advanced individual training in their Military Occupational Specialty (MOS).
Responsibilities: Expertise in a specific MOS
Supervising soldiers in their area of expertise
Performing advanced tasks and duties
Leading small teams and missions
Continuous skill development and advancement

E-4.Description: Corporals provide leadership and supervision to soldiers in a squad or small team.
Responsibilities: Leading and training soldiers in basic and advanced skills
Ensuring the unit's readiness and combat efficiency
Planning and executing small missions
Maintaining discipline and morale within the squad
Advanced weapons qualification and training

E-5.Description: Sergeants are senior non-commissioned officers who lead squads or small teams of soldiers.
Responsibilities: Developing and implementing training programs
Providing mentorship and career guidance to soldiers
Assessing and evaluating soldier performance
Planning and coordinating larger missions
Increased responsibility for equipment and resources

E-6.Description: Staff Sergeants serve as senior enlisted advisors to officers and supervise multiple squads or teams.
Responsibilities: Advanced training in leadership, tactics, and military science
Developing and implementing unit-level training programs
Overseeing resource allocation and logistics
Mentoring junior NCOs and Warrant Officers
Preparing soldiers for deployment and combat

E-7.Description: Sergeant First Class is a senior enlisted leader with advanced technical expertise or a broad range of leadership responsibilities.
Responsibilities: Serving as the senior enlisted advisor to a company-sized unit
Advanced individual training in a specific skill set
Developing and implementing training programs at the battalion level
Mentoring and developing senior NCOs
Preparing units for complex missions and deployments

E-9.Description: The Sergeant Major is the senior enlisted advisor to a battalion or larger unit, providing leadership and guidance to the entire command.
Responsibilities: Overseeing all enlisted personnel in the unit
Developing and implementing unit-wide training and readiness programs
Ensuring the professional and personal development of soldiers and NCOs
Providing strategic advice to the commander
Representing the unit at higher echelons

E-9.Description: The Command Sergeant Major is the senior enlisted leader of a brigade or larger unit, responsible for the overall enlisted welfare and training.
Responsibilities: Developing and implementing brigade-wide training and readiness programs
Overseeing the professional and personal development of all enlisted personnel
Providing strategic advice to the brigade commander
Ensuring compliance with Army regulations and policies
Representing the brigade at higher echelons
